nodes.documentation:
@notice TokenEscrowMarketplace is an ERC20 payment channel that enables users to send BLT by exchanging signatures off-chain
 Users approve the contract address to transfer BLT on their behalf using the standard ERC20.approve function
 After approval, either the user or the contract admin initiates the transfer of BLT into the contract
 Once in the contract, users can send payments via a signed message to another user. 
 The signature transfers BLT from lockup to the recipient's balance
 Users can withdraw funds at any time. Or the admin can release them on the user's behalf
 
 BLT is stored in the contract by address
 
 Only the AttestationLogic contract is authorized to release funds once a jobs is complete
nodes.name: TokenEscrowMarketplace
moveTokensToEscrowLockupFor
validateLockupTokensSig

constructor.details: Some actions are restricted to be performed by the attestationLogic contract. Signing logic is upgradeable in case the signTypedData spec changes

params._attestationLogic: Address of current attestation logic contract

moveTokensToEscrowLockupFor(address,uint.details: Authorized by a signTypedData signature by sender Sigs can only be used once. They contain a unique nonce So an action can be repeated, with a different signature

params._delegationSig: Signed hash of these input parameters so an admin can submit this on behalf of a user
params._nonce: Unique Id so signatures can't be replayed

releaseTokensFromEscrow(uint256).details: Token balance retreived by accountId. Can be different address from the one that deposited tokens

releaseTokensFromEscrowFor(address,uint2.details: Authorized by a signTypedData signature by sender Sigs can only be used once. They contain a unique nonce So an action can be repeated, with a different signature

params._delegationSig: Signed hash of these input parameters so an admin can submit this on behalf of a user
params._nonce: Unique Id so signatures can't be replayed
Unique Id for sig to make it one-time-use
params._paymentSig: Signed parameters by payer authorizing payment

methods.constructor: The TokenEscrowMarketplace constructor initializes the interfaces to the other contracts

moveTokensToEscrowLockup(uint256).notice: Lockup tokens by user. Must be preceeded by approve

moveTokensToEscrowLockupFor(address,uint.notice: Lockup tokens for set time period on behalf of user. Must be preceeded by approve

releaseTokensFromEscrow(uint256).notice: Release tokens back to payer's available balance if lockup expires

releaseTokensFromEscrowFor(address,uint2.notice: Withdraw tokens from escrow back to requester

requestTokenPayment(address,address,uint.notice: Pay tokens to receiver from payer's escrow given a valid signature

userdoc.notice: TokenEscrowMarketplace is an ERC20 payment channel that enables users to send BLT by exchanging signatures off-chain Users approve the contract address to transfer BLT on their behalf using the standard ERC20.approve function After approval, either the user or the contract admin initiates the transfer of BLT into the contract Once in the contract, users can send payments via a signed message to another user.  The signature transfers BLT from lockup to the recipient's balance Users can withdraw funds at any time. Or the admin can release them on the user's behalf  BLT is stored in the contract by address  Only the AttestationLogic contract is authorized to release funds once a jobs is complete
